annotation.spannedText: As a result of high 2-dose measles vaccination coverage in the United States and improved control of measles in the World Health Organization's Region of the Americas, the United States declared measles elimination (defined as interruption of year-round endemic transmission) in 2000

classMention.mentionClass: As a result of high 2-dose measles vaccination coverage in the United States and improved control of measles in the World Health Organization's Region of the Americas, the United States declared measles elimination (defined as interruption of year-round endemic transmission) in 2000

annotation.spannedText: Measles transmission in pockets of unvaccinated persons increases the risk for transmission to vulnerable groups, such as those who cannot be vaccinated because of underlying medical conditions, or infants too young to be vaccinated

classMention.mentionClass: Measles transmission in pockets of unvaccinated persons increases the risk for transmission to vulnerable groups, such as those who cannot be vaccinated because of underlying medical conditions, or infants too young to be vaccinated

annotation.spannedText: High population immunity secondary to high measles vaccination coverage has maintained measles elimination in the United States since declaration of elimination in 2000

classMention.mentionClass: High population immunity secondary to high measles vaccination coverage has maintained measles elimination in the United States since declaration of elimination in 2000

annotation.spannedText: Exemptions from mandated immunizations have been shown to increase risk for acquiring disease as well as increasing the risk of a disease outbreak at the community level

classMention.mentionClass: Exemptions from mandated immunizations have been shown to increase risk for acquiring disease as well as increasing the risk of a disease outbreak at the community level

annotation.spannedText: Health care providers should encourage vaccination of all eligible patients who do not have other evidence of measles immunity

classMention.mentionClass: Health care providers should encourage vaccination of all eligible patients who do not have other evidence of measles immunity

annotation.spannedText: Children without contraindications should receive their first dose of measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR) vaccine at age 12–15 months and a second dose at age 4–6 years

classMention.mentionClass: Children without contraindications should receive their first dose of measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR) vaccine at age 12–15 months and a second dose at age 4–6 years

annotation.spannedText: Before international travel, infants aged 6-11 months should receive one dose of MMR and children aged 12 months and older should receive two doses of MMR vaccine separated by at least 28 days

classMention.mentionClass: Before international travel, infants aged 6-11 months should receive one dose of MMR and children aged 12 months and older should receive two doses of MMR vaccine separated by at least 28 days

annotation.spannedText: Adults born during or after 1957 who are at high risk for measles (i.e., health care personnel, international travelers, and students at postsecondary educational institutions) and who do not have other evidence of measles immunity should also receive 2 doses of MMR vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: Adults born during or after 1957 who are at high risk for measles (i.e., health care personnel, international travelers, and students at postsecondary educational institutions) and who do not have other evidence of measles immunity should also receive 2 doses of MMR vaccine

annotation.spannedText: Other adults without evidence of measles immunity should receive at least 1 dose of MMR vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: Other adults without evidence of measles immunity should receive at least 1 dose of MMR vaccine

annotation.spannedText: Measles should be considered in the differential diagnosis of patients with febrile illness and rash

classMention.mentionClass: Measles should be considered in the differential diagnosis of patients with febrile illness and rash

annotation.spannedText: Patients with clinical symptoms compatible with measles should be asked about recent travel abroad or contact with travelers, and their vaccination status should be verified

classMention.mentionClass: Patients with clinical symptoms compatible with measles should be asked about recent travel abroad or contact with travelers, and their vaccination status should be verified

annotation.spannedText: Patients with suspected measles should be promptly screened before entering waiting rooms and appropriately isolated ... or have their doctor's office appointments scheduled at the end of the day to prevent exposure of other patients

classMention.mentionClass: Patients with suspected measles should be promptly screened before entering waiting rooms and appropriately isolated ... or have their doctor's office appointments scheduled at the end of the day to prevent exposure of other patients

annotation.spannedText: Serology as well as viral specimens should be collected for laboratory testing

classMention.mentionClass: Serology as well as viral specimens should be collected for laboratory testing

annotation.spannedText: suspected measles cases should be reported to local health departments immediately

classMention.mentionClass: suspected measles cases should be reported to local health departments immediately

annotation.spannedText: it is important to encourage timely delivery of measles vaccination for U.S. residents before overseas travel

classMention.mentionClass: it is important to encourage timely delivery of measles vaccination for U.S. residents before overseas travel
